name: Lamb Korma
history: Lamb Korma is a rich and aromatic dish with roots in Mughlai cuisine. It's known for its creamy texture and subtle blend of spices, often featuring nuts and yogurt.
description: Lamb Korma is a luxurious curry made with tender pieces of lamb simmered in a creamy sauce with yogurt, almonds, and a mix of gentle spices. It's a decadent dish often reserved for special occasions.

instructions.title: Marinate the Lamb
instructions.description: Marinate the lamb in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, ground almonds, coriander, cumin, turmeric, and salt. Set aside for at least 2 hours or overnight.

instructions.title: Cook the Onions
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pot. Add onions and cook until golden brown.

instructions.title: Add Lamb and Spices
instructions.description: Add the marinated lamb to the pot. Cook until the lamb starts to brown.

instructions.title: Simmer the Curry
instructions.description: Add water to cover the lamb. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the lamb is tender.

instructions.title: Finish with Cream and Garam Masala
instructions.description: Stir in the cream and garam masala. Cook for a few more minutes until the sauce thickens.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro and slivered almonds. Serve hot with rice or naan.

tips: Marinating the lamb for a longer time will tenderize it and enhance the flavor.
Adjust the level of spices to suit your taste preferences.
variations: Use chicken or beef instead of lamb for a different flavor.
Add vegetables like peas or potatoes for a more wholesome dish.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a decorative serving dish, garnished with fresh herbs.
Accompany with a side of mint chutney or cucumber raita.
